intro: Hendecandra montevidensis, commonly known as the Montevidense hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Uruguay and southern Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture, while its flowers are usually pink or red in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and riverbanks.
